intro: Calcaratolobelia mcvaughii, commonly known as the McVaugh's lobelia, is a rare flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from blue to purple. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded habitats such as woodlands and streambanks. It has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered inflorescences. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
